intro: Guettarda elegans, commonly known as the silver mistflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has finely divided, lance-shaped leaves that give it a feathery appearance, and it is often grown as an ornamental plant in gardens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it suitable for shaded garden areas. Guettarda elegans is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
